data.title: The George Washington University
data.meta_description: We offer a curated portfolio of simulation programs and consulting services
data.text:
Overview of the GW Nursing Simulation Initiatives from GW School of Nursing on Vimeo.

In response to the tremendous needs of health care organizations, academic institutions and simulation professionals to assess and enhance their simulation center operations, educate instructors, extend hospital-based simulation programs and develop simulation operations leaders, we offer a curated portfolio of simulation programs and consulting services. These programs and services are offered through The GW Nursing Simulation Initiatives and were created by Dr. Pamela Jeffries, who developed the NLN/Jeffries Simulation Theory.

Purpose

Cultivate evidenced-based simulation programs

Educate instructors

Advance future simulation leaders

Improve participant, patient and system outcomes

R.A.I.S.E. High

Courses

Those interested in our educational opportunities can choose courses that are delivered as hybrid courses to include virtual learning in conjunction with face-to-face workshops.

Immersions

Intensives

Clinical Simulation MOOC

The Clinical Simulation MOOC is a 7-week course that provides you with key strategies to help understand the foundation of Clinical Simulations. During each module, you will learn about 7 key components of Clinical Simulation Across the Health Professions and its' impact in your current position as a healthcare professional.

Visit Us

GW Nursing is home to a one-of-a-kind simulation space that boasts a recently added Objective Structured Clinical Exam space available to our students and partners.

Check Out Our Space

Contact Us
